required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility and Preliminary Effects of the Resilience-based, Energy Management to Enhance Wellbeing in Systemic Sclerosis (RENEW) Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility and Preliminary Effects of the Resilience-based, Energy Management to Enhance Wellbeing in Systemic Sclerosis (RENEW) Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: Researchers are testing a web-based peer-led program to help manage energy and symptoms in people who have scleroderma. Resilience-based, Energy Management to Enhance Wellbeing (RENEW) was created by researchers, doctors, and patients with scleroderma. The goal is to help people with scleroderma feel better.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Pilot study, one arm, pre-test, post-test trial

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility as assessed by intervention participant retention
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants who complete the study

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility as assessed by the participation in intervention related phone calls

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility as assessed by active participant involvement
secondary_outcome.description: Number of minutes spent accessing the RENEW website/app

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility as assessed by the peer mentor health coach time
Feasibility as assessed by the time spent in preparation for intervention phone calls
secondary_outcome.description: Preparation time of peer mentors will be documented in minutes.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Resilience-based, Energy Management to Enhance Wellbeing (RENEW)
arm_group.description: RENEW is a 12-week program in which participants are paired with a peer mentor who serves as their health coach throughout the intervention period. The website serves as the program "workbook" to help promote skill practice and attainment in areas like goal setting, pacing, relaxation, etc.

intervention.intervention_name: Resilience-based, Energy Management to Enhance Wellbeing (RENEW)
intervention.description: The program includes unlimited website access and 10 scheduled phone calls with an assigned peer mentor.
intervention.arm_group_label: Resilience-based, Energy Management to Enhance Wellbeing (RENEW)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a diagnosis of systemic sclerosis including:
- Diffuse or limited cutaneous
- Have access to a reliable, internet-connected device (e.g. computer, tablet)
- Be able to read, speak, and understand English
- Participants need to report a score of at least 4 on a scale of 0 - 10 of fatigue severity, a cut-off for at least moderate fatigue in other fatiguing conditions.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Complex, unstable health issues that would preclude full participation in the study
- Planning to start new treatment for fatigue, pain, mood during the study period

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and Research Associate Professor, Institute of Gerontology, Medical School
